title: Create the Gapminder dataset
text:
# Import necessary libraries
import pandas as pd
from gapminder import gapminder

# Rename 'lifeExp' to 'life_expectancy' and 'gdpPercap' to 'gdp_per_capita'
gapminder = gapminder.rename(columns={'lifeExp': 'life_expectancy',
                                      'pop': 'population_millions', 
                                      'gdpPercap': 'gdp_per_capita'})

# Convert population to millions
gapminder['population_millions'] = gapminder['population_millions'] / 1_000_000

# Create a new pandas DataFrame from the modified gapminder data
gapminder_df = pd.DataFrame(gapminder)

# Save the DataFrame as a CSV file
gapminder_df.to_csv('gapminder.csv', index=False)

# Print the first 3 rows of the DataFrame
print(gapminder_df.head(3))

       country continent  year  life_expectancy  population_millions  \
0  Afghanistan      Asia  1952           28.801             8.425333   
1  Afghanistan      Asia  1957           30.332             9.240934   
2  Afghanistan      Asia  1962           31.997            10.267083   

   gdp_per_capita  
0      779.445314  
1      820.853030  
2      853.100710

title: Life Expectancy and GDP per Capita
text:
This page explores the relationship between life expectancy and GDP per capita using the Gapminder dataset.

import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# Load dataset
df = pd.read_csv("gapminder.csv")

# Scatter plot
plt.figure()
plt.scatter(df["gdp_per_capita"], df["life_expectancy"])
plt.xlabel("GDP per Capita")
plt.ylabel("Life Expectancy")
plt.title("Life Expectancy vs GDP per Capita")
plt.show()

title: Life Expectancy and GDP per Capita
text:
This page explores the relationship between life expectancy and GDP per capita using the Gapminder dataset.

import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# Load dataset
df = pd.read_csv("gapminder.csv")

# Scatter plot
plt.figure()
plt.scatter(df["gdp_per_capita"], df["life_expectancy"])
plt.xlabel("GDP per Capita")
plt.ylabel("Life Expectancy")

title: Country Analysis
text:
This page analyzes changes in life expectancy, GDP per capita, and population over time for Canada using the Gapminder dataset.

import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# Load dataset
df = pd.read_csv("gapminder.csv")

# Select Canada
country_name = "Canada"
country_df = df[df["country"] == country_name].sort_values("year")

# Plot trends over time
plt.figure()
plt.plot(country_df["year"], country_df["life_expectancy"], label="Life Expectancy")
plt.plot(country_df["year"], country_df["gdp_per_capita"], label="GDP per Capita")
plt.plot(country_df["year"], country_df["population_millions"], label="Population (Millions)")

plt.xlabel("Year")
plt.title("Trends Over Time in Canada")
plt.legend()
plt.show()

title: Gapminder Data Explorer
text:
The Gapminder dataset contains country-level data for 142 countries from 1952 to 2007 (at 5-year intervals), including life expectancy, GDP per capita, and population.

title: Life Expectancy and Population
text:
This page explores the relationship between life expectancy and population using the Gapminder dataset.

import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# Load dataset
df = pd.read_csv("gapminder.csv")

# Scatter plot
plt.figure()
plt.scatter(df["population_millions"], df["life_expectancy"])
plt.xlabel("Population (Millions)")
plt.ylabel("Life Expectancy")
plt.title("Life Expectancy vs Population")
plt.show()
